evidence_span: The effect of axial strain is dependent on test temperature. At low temperatures, high values of anisotropy factor are observed initially, which decrease as the axial strain increases. At high temperature, the effect of axial strain is reversed; low values of anisotropy are observed initially, which increase with increasing axial strain.

evidence_span: Strain anisotropy in polycrystalline Zircaloy-2 is associated with the resistance to contractile strain along the C-axis of the close-packed hexagonal alpha-phase structure and disappears rapidly as the transformation from alpha to beta phase progresses
